_source.text: [5] Historically, educational data have been used to support the politics of folks who want to show what education has done (or, more probably, not done) in the past, to support the theory that traditional education strategies (that is, my ways of teaching) are better than all the new-fangled strategies, to support the myth that learning must be fun instead of work, and to support other theories of teaching rather than theories of learning.
